quiz.text: Anuj, Banti and Chetan started a business by investing Rs. ‘A’, Rs. ‘2A’ and Rs. (2A – 10,000). After 4 months, Dheeraj entered into the business by making an investment which is 90% of the investment made by Anuj and Chetan together initially. At the end of one year, total profit is earned by them together is Rs. 75600 and profit share of Chetan and Dheeraj is same. Quantity-I: If Anuj, Chetan and Mehul invested Rs. (A – 4000), Rs. (A + 12000) and Rs. (A + 2000), respectively, in another business and after 6 months Anuj withdraw Rs. 8000. Find the profit share of Mehul at the end of the year if the total profit of earned by them together is Rs. 59400. Quantity-II: If Banti, Chetan and Eshant invested Rs. (A + 4000), Rs. (A + 10000) and Rs. ‘B’, respectively, in a company. At the end of the year, the profit of Eshant is Rs. 4900 out of the total profit of Rs. 14350. Find the amount invested by Eshant.
options: Quantity-I > Quantity-II
Quantity-I < Quantity-II
Quantity-I ≤ Quantity-II
Quantity-I = Quantity-II or No relation
Quantity-I ≥ Quantity-II

They are nowhere as sweeping as last year’s nationwide shutdown, so their economic impact will be relatively limited. Arguments: I. Yes, the lockdowns are not as stringent and firms have learnt to adapt. II. No, the two shocks in a space of a year are likely to cause long-term damage to smaller enterprises and informal sector employment.

Only argument II is strong
Either I or II is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both I and II are strong

Course of action: I. A detailed scrutiny of the state of affairs in some of the largest discoms is needed. II. Free or near free power for agriculture should be scrutinised. III. Only Course of action II follows
Both I and II follow
All of I, II and III follow

options: The data given in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question while data given in statement I alone and statement III alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data given in statement I and statement III combined together is sufficient to answer the question while data given in statement II is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data given either in statement I and statement III combined together is sufficient to answer the question or data given in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
Data given in any of the two statements combined together is sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: Direction: A statement is given below followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and III. You have to assume everything in the statement to be true, then consider the three conclusions together and decide which of them logically follows beyond a reasonable doubt from the information given in the statement. Give answer: Jallianwala Bagh massacre changed the idiom of Indian nationalism. Mahatma Gandhi, despite his absence from Punjab, assumed centre stage after that. Jawaharlal Nehru became Gandhi’s trusted lieutenant, and thus began the longest political partnership of modern India. I. Mahatma Gandhi’s leadership brought the Jallianwala Bagh event into the grand saga of Indian nationalism. II. Jallianwala Bagh event shaped the contours of the anti-colonial struggle and entered India into a political phase of mass nationalism. III. Revolutionary movement of Bhagat Singh and Udham Singh were products of the massacre.
options: If only conclusion I follows.
If only conclusion I and II follows.
If only conclusion III follows.
If only conclusion II follows.
None follow

Only I and III
Only III

The cost price of a book is Rs. 720 and it is sold at the profit of P%. If the cost price and the selling price are interchanged, the loss incurred is L%. L is 20% less than that by P.

Which of the following statement/s is/are true?

I: The selling price of the book if the shopkeeper wants to earn the profit of (L + P)%, is Rs. 1044.

II: If the marked price of the book is 2P% more than that of cost price and an L% of discount is given on its marked price, then the selling price of the book will be Rs. 864.

III: If the ratio of the cost price to selling price of the book is 10:7, then the loss on the book will be (P + 10)%.
options: Only II
Only I
Only I and III
Only I and II
None of these

quiz.text: Read the following information and answers the question that follows. An e-commerce site sells product ranging from apparels to home appliances. If a customer wants to return a product, they have to do so within a time-frame of 15 minutes of receiving the product. The same delivery agent who brought the product to them will wait for 15 minutes and take the product back with him in case the customer wants to return it. A lot of customers have complained about this system as it does not give them ample amount of time to check and judge the product. Many customers may not be available at the time of delivery (and the product is received by their family members/roommates) in which case, they are stuck with the product even if they dislike it or find some flaws in it later on. The site has considered all the complaints and now wants to extend a different policy for returns. It rolled out a survey to all its past customers which included a few questions. A 'No' to which of the following questions may lead the site to reconsider its old policy of '15-minutes returns only'? (A) The time frame will be increased to 2 days, but the refund will be initiated only after 15 days. Do you agree to the new policy? (B) If the time frame is increased, only certain products (tops, dresses, trousers, TV sets, mobile phones) can be returned while the rest (books, shades, refrigerators, washing machines, shoes, décor items, lights and bulbs, cosmetics, etc.) cannot be returned. Do you agree to the new policy? (C) The time frame will be increased to 2 days, but the person has to pay an extra amount of ₹200 during the purchase which will be refunded (irrespective of whether the item is returned or not) after 4 days of the item getting delivered. Do you agree to the new policy? (D) If the time frame is increased, a person has to opt for returns while making the purchase itself and if he does not do so, he will not be eligible for returning the item later. Do you agree to the new policy?
options: Only B
None of the given
Only C and D
Only A and C
Only B and C

Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to 'PLI Scheme for Food Processing Industry'?

A. It is being implemented by Ministry of Food Processing Industries.

B. It was launched in the year 2021.

C. The Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme for Food Processing Industry has only 3 components.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: What does ‘O’ stands for in PM POSHAN Abhiyaan?
options: Over
Overachieving
Overarching
Outcast
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are the components of Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana? 

A. Shishu - covering loans up to Rs. 50,000 

B. Kishor - covering loans above Rs. 50,000 and upto 5 lakhs 

C. Tarun - covering loans above Rs. 5 lakh and upto 20 lakhs
options: A and B only
B and C only
A and C only
A, B and C
None of the Above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect with respect to Prime Minister’s Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP)?
options: Khadi and Village Industries Commission (KVIC) is the nodal agency at national level
There is no income ceiling for setting up projects
Per capita investment should not exceed Rs 1 lakh for plain areas and Rs 1.5 lakh for hilly areas
As per RBI guidelines, project costing up to Rs. 5 lakhs under PMEGP loans are free from collateral security
Applicants from Aspirational districts & Transgenders have been included under the Special Category applicants for availing higher subsidies

quiz.text:
Recently, the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme has recently been launched. Presently, the scheme envisages to take-up 1275 stations for upgradation/modernisation. Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to this scheme?

A. High level platforms (600-740 mm) shall be provided at all categories of stations.

B. Master Plan should have suitable spaces earmarked for 5G towers.

C. Amenities for Divyangjan at stations shall be as per guidelines issued by Railway Board.
options: B and C
A and C
A and B
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (May 2023), ___________________________ has launched the Udyam Assist Platform (UAP) to facilitate formalisation of Informal Micro Enterprises (IMEs) through online generation of Udyam Assist Certificate.
options: Ministry of Commerce and Industry

Ministry of Rural Development
Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship
Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises

quiz.text: Which of the following is the purpose of the $82 million loan approved recently (May 2023) by the World Bank for India?
options: To support agricultural development and increase food production in rural areas.
To improve healthcare infrastructure and provide better medical services to rural communities.
To enhance environmental conservation efforts and protect natural resources.
To promote the adoption of global best practices for animal health management in India.
To invest in renewable energy projects and reduce carbon emissions in the country.

quiz.text: Recently, the Prime Minister has launched the Inclusive Development (Samaveshi Vikaas) campaign on 24th April 2023. Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to the campaign?
options: 9 campaigns under the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav-Inclusive Development (Samaveshi Vikaas) theme have been launched.
5 campaigns are under Ministry of Rural Development.
SVAMITVA, Meri Sampatti, Mera Haq campaign is being run by Ministry of Panchayati Raj.
Natural Farming with SHG Women campaign is being co-run by Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare and Ministry of Rural Development.
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (March 2023), information has been shared by Union Minister of Minority Affairs regarding Wheat based nutrition Programme. Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to Wheat based nutrition Programme?
options: It was launched in 1986.
It is a centrally sponsored scheme.
Nodal Ministry is Ministry of Women and Child Development.
Beneficiaries include children of pre-school age, nursing and expectant mothers in disadvantaged areas with high IMR.
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (May 2023), the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) has relaxed norms for surety bonds. Surety bond is a legal binding contract between which of the following parties?
options: A Promisor and a Promisee.
A Promisor, a Promisee, and a Beneficiary.
The Principal, the Obligee and the Surety.
The Obligee and the Surety
A Promisor and the Surety.

quiz.text: As per recent (May 2023) news, Public Sector Banks’ total profit has reached Rs 1,04,649 crore in FY23. In percentage terms which of the following banks had the highest net profit growth?

UCO Bank
Bank of Baroda (BoB)
